meanings.definition: To draw more money from a bank account than is available
meanings.sent1: She accidentally overdraws her account when she forgets to check her balance.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overdraw his account towards the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overdraws its acorn savings account for winter.
meanings.sent4: The river overdraws its banks during heavy rains.
meanings.sent5: The artist overdraws the details in the painting, making it look unrealistic.

meanings.definition: The act of drawing a picture with too much detail or shading
meanings.sent1: Her overdrawing of the flower made it look messy instead of simple.
meanings.sent2: The overdrawing of the landscape added depth and richness to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The overdrawing of the stick figure made it look like a complex robot.
meanings.sent4: The overdrawing of the clouds in the sky gave the painting a dreamy feel.
meanings.sent5: His overdrawing of the tree made it appear more lifelike and vibrant.

meanings.definition: The process of creating an overdraft on a bank account
meanings.sent1: His frequent overdrawing led to hefty bank fees.
meanings.sent2: The bank notifies customers of any overdrawing on their accounts.
meanings.sent3: The overdrawing of the account caused a temporary financial hiccup.
meanings.sent4: She learned her lesson about overdrawing after facing financial consequences.
meanings.sent5: The overdrawing of the account left him in a tight spot until his next paycheck.
